title: Sport Club Barroso
text:
Sport Club Barroso, commonly known as Barroso, was a Brazilian <a href="association%20football">football</a> club based in <a href="Macei%C3%B3">Maceió</a>, <a href="Alagoas">Alagoas state</a>. They won the <a href="Campeonato%20Alagoano">Campeonato Alagoano</a> once.
History.
The club was founded on 11 June 1921. They won the <a href="Campeonato%20Alagoano">Campeonato Alagoano</a> in 1946, and finished in the second place in the 1947 edition, finishing behind <a href="Esporte%20Clube%20Alexandria">Alexandria</a>. The club folded in 1951.
Stadium.
Esporte Clube Barroso played their home games at <a href="Est%C3%A1dio%20Gustavo%20Paiva">Estádio Gustavo Paiva</a>, nicknamed "Estádio do Mutange". The stadium has a maximum capacity of 6,000 people.
